item.title: Bags of bread being flytipped by public bins, 21st August
item.description:
Resident calling stating that there is black bags of bread being dumped by the public bins in broomfield road by the warren. This is causing an issue with vermin and peoples dogs are running across the road to get this and could get injured and also could become ill if they eat this. Please can this be looked into.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Midhurst Hill, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Utility area cabinet pulled apart and exposed, 21st August
item.description:
Doors housing mains wiring/gas pipes etc and other utilities by the lifts….. are now open and falling off and exposed to further damage and vandalism, having being pulled out of the wall.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in mulberry way off jenningtree way, 21st August
item.description:
Rubble, wood with nails in, big tank with oil in it and people are adding to this. people are walking in the road to avoid this, a dog has been injured and has got a nail in her paw, please can this be removed urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mulberry Way, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights not working, 21st August
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights not working Construction work has gone beyond previous timeline. No timeline displayed of how much longer it will be.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste left in a corner every week, 21st August
item.description:
Someone is using a corner of the common space as a dog toilet every single day. After a week there are several piles of poop and lots of flies. Adults and children use the pavement next to it to take their bikes/bins from their gardens/patios. I don't know who is doing this and it's very difficult to catch them infraganti without a camera. It's disgusting and dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keel Close, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Padua Road, Anerley, London

item.title: On the pavement outside 2 Brondesbury Road NW6 6AS, 21st August
item.description:
Somebody has dumped a lot of rubbish. Parts of a bed frame, a chair, a small unit and rubbish bags on the pavement either last night or this morning.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brondesbury Road, London

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Urgent Safety Concern, 21st August
item.description:
I’m writing to report damage to the curb near the entrance to the Thomas Philipot’s Almshouses. This area is regularly used by elderly residents, and the current condition poses a significant safety risk. It’s likely only a matter of time before someone is seriously injured. In addition, there are several deep potholes nearby that further contribute to the hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Philipot Path, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Appalling traffic management, 21st August
item.description:
Vehicles going through red lights with no penalties and zero human on-site management. Bus lane should be suspended as it has taken 1+ hour to get through today. No alternative route options for local residents. Council should have on site personnel to management the lights and traffic. An utter disgrace.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Filston Road, Northumberland Heath, London
